alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 10:44AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Lancaster, Fairfield and Kershaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 101.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 101.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1100 PM EST.this evening at 1045 PM EST.
